subject: [Radiance-general] falsecolor2/wxfalsecolor v0.2 released
body:
All.

I have updated my Python falsecolor scripts to version 0.2. This
update includes a new stand alone command line executable to replace
falsecolor on Windows.

Download:

You can find download links for the Windows executables and a zip archive here:

http://code.google.com/p/pyrat/downloads/list


A short introduction page is here:

http://sites.google.com/site/tbleicher/radiance/wxfalsecolor


Core Features:

falsecolor2 supports all the features of the original falsecolor. I
have added a few new features and some original features behave a bit
differently:

*) The formatting of the default legend is different.
*) -cb creates a falsecolor image of discreet colours instead of an
obese variation of contour lines.
*) -h shows a summary of the command line options. This option does
not create an image but prints a help message to stdout (terminal).
*) -lp allows you to specify the legend position; legends above and
below the image are horizontal instead of vertical.
*) -mask <minvalue> masks all values below minvalue with the
background color (black).
*) -z creates legends starting at 0

With wxfalsecolor you can

*) load and display Radiance RGBE images
*) display RGB and Lux values (even after conversion to falsecolor image)
*) set falsecolor2 options interactively
*) drag-and-drop images in a desktop environment


Enjoy.

Thomas
